Higher Learning Omar Epps, Kristy Swanson, Michael Rapaport, Ice Cube, Jennifer Connelly, Laurence Fishburne Directed by John Singleton R 127 minutes

Dawns a new semester at "prestigious" Columbus University and the ethnically divided campus is setting up like a mini-Bosnia and Herzegovina. Over there on the quad is Disneyland, the gathering spot for white racist airheads, over here is Chinatown, over there is South of the Border and so forth. Every conceivable cause, from women's rights to black power and white supremacy, has its cadre of bromide-spouting advocates, and in dormitories and booze-soaked hangouts the hatred builds to a skinhead sniper's rampage. VIOLENCE Murder, attempted rape and assaults both physical and verbal. SEX In tune with the above. PROFANITY Ditto. FOOTNOTE This is a children's movie? No, but Mr. Singleton's critically acclaimed "Boyz N the Hood," also with Ice Cube, was popular with children and many teen-agers are likely to want to see this film too. Simply put, this is no "Boyz N the Hood." For Which Children? AGES 13 and up Not for any children, of course, but many youngsters will get into this film anyway. PETER M. NICHOLS TAKING THE CHILDREN
